content: The overall objective of the U.S. space program during the Cold War was to demonstrate technological and scientific superiority over the Soviet Union. Both countries saw space exploration as a way to showcase their technological advancements and gain global prestige. The U.S. space program focused on achieving a series of milestones, such as launching the first satellite, sending the first human into space, and landing humans on the moon. The ultimate goal was to demonstrate superior capabilities in science, technology, and military strength.
